commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Fix typo affecting support for nested multi-line comments

commits.author: Jacob Bandes-Storch
commits.summary: Re-enable pairing parentheses for string interpolation \(…)

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: An enumeration case with a payload was messing up the indent
commits.body:
This is because our decrease indent pattern was looking for a case with a colon on the same line, but an enumeration case with a payload will also have a colon, so we now require the colon to be at the end of the line (sans whitespace and trailing comments).

Example of enumeration with payload:

	enum Error: ErrorType {
		case POSIXError(action: String, errorNumber: CInt, systemExit: CInt)
		case InternalError(reason: String, systemExit: CInt)
		case UsageError
	}

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: For documentation with Swift results we ignore other languages
commits.body: A downside is that the fragment identifier seems to work better for non-Swift matches, for example looking up GCD constants (defines) will go to the top of the GCD documentation, but for C it will jump to the constant that we looked up.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Introduce TM_SWIFT_DOCUMENTATION_FILTER environment variable
commits.body: This defaults to '^(?!.*?iOS\.docset)' which means that iOS documentation is ignored by default.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Add documentation lookup (<kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⌃H</kbd>)
commits.body:
This command uses `docsetutil` to lookup the current word/selection.

It does not filter out C or Objective-C results since some things are only available in these docs. It also does not filter on iOS/OS X since we don’t know which of the SDKs the user prefer.

The command borrows heavily from the documentation lookup command in the Objective-C bundle, it would make sense to merge them, but the version in the Objective-C bundle also looks for selectors and manual pages so it is a tad more complex.

commits.summary: Various syntax updates - nil literal - coalescing operator - preliminary support for parameter names - more (and more up to date) builtin types

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Grammar: Limit restructuredText items accepted
commits.body: This corrects an issue with various rules in the restructuredText grammar being over-ambitious with matches extending outside of the comment block. Being very conservative for now, we can expand the items accepted as Apple documents what items are applicable in documentation comments. Fixes #11.

commits.author: Michael Sheets

commits.body: Give a unique scope to documentation comments and add support for nested block comments.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Revamp string literal matching
commits.body: Now scope the entire string as a whole and use embedded scopes for interpolation.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Improve punctuation scopes

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Allow for functions without a body
commits.body: These are used in protocol blocks, before the end was never found as a `{}` block isn't used.

commits.author: John Regner
commits.summary: Add simple folding markers for swift
commits.body: The Folding markers are based on the simple '{\s*$' and '^\s*}'

commits.author: John Regner
commits.summary: Improved matching of capture specifiers
commits.body:
Previously capture specifiers were lumped in with declaration-specifier.
Moved them to their own group.
Improved matching of unowned(safe) and unowned(unsafe). Previously these
would not have matched but their incorrect counterparts
(unownedsafe, unownedunsafe) would have matched.

commits.author: John Regner

commits.body: Remove deprecated method and save modified files before running.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Match invocation method from Shell Script bundle
commits.body: This adds a <kbd class='tabTrigger'>swift⇥</kbd> shebang snippet to work in any document and enhances the <kbd class='tabTrigger'>env⇥</kbd> snippet when used in a swift document. The snippets will only fire when used at the very beginning of a document.
